channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IN

item.title: Report E-2025020007
item.description:
Report E-2025020007

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-05T03:26:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-28
  • City: CONNERSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RECLAIMED ENERGY CO., INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: 4 drums of non-regulated material was shipped to Reclaimed Energy on a hazardous waste manifest 0273408676JJK on 1/28/2025. Material was sampled and analyzed per our waste analysis plan. it was found that one drum was hazardous (flash point <140F) and should've shipped as their paint related material waste stream. The manifest was updated to reflect this change. Customer was notified and said one drum was mislabeled prior to shipment. Drum was relabeled for hazardous steam and processed accordingly.

item.title: Report E-2025020000
item.description:
Report E-2025020000

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-05T03:26:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-24
  • City: Indianapolis
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SUPERIOR INDUSTRIAL SOLUTIONS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While unloading, a few drops of material were observed leaking from the top of a drum. Upon inspection, it was discovered that the drum gasket was bad. The drum was placed in an overpack and the released material was cleaned up.

item.title: Report E-2025010434
item.description:
Report E-2025010434

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-05T03:26:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-18
  • City: MARKLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to a forklift accident during unloading that resulted in the drum being punctured. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into two (2) 5-gallon poly drums. The 55-gallon drum of product was placed in one (1) 85-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025010397
item.description:
Report E-2025010397

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-05T03:26:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-18
  • City: ELKHART
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two (2) teaspoons of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to a forklift accident resulting in the drum being punctured. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The damaged 55-gallon drum was then overpacked into one (1) 85-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025010361
item.description:
Report E-2025010361

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-24
  • City: ALEXANDRIA
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On January 24, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint was damaged by a forklift and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Indiana Spill Response (ISR) to remediate the impacted site. The crew containerized the damaged drum in one (1) 85-gallon drum. ISR utilized granular absorbents and hand tools to further remediate the site. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report X-2025011189
item.description:
Report X-2025011189

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-18
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 01/18/2025 at approximately 1230, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 868809 at the hub facility in Indianapolis, reporting a hazardous material spill. The shipment consisted of 4 metal cans packaged a fiberboard box. Due to mishandling, the shipment was damaged, resulting in spillage, completely covering the package in paint, rendering the marks and labels illegible. 1 of the 4 metal cans was found completely empty. The undamaged cans were placed in a salvage drum and awaits an amended Shipper's declaration for further transport.

item.title: Report E-2025010365
item.description:
Report E-2025010365

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-18
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of Klean Strip Acetone released from one (1) gallon metal pail and one (1) gallon of Citristrip Stripping Gel released from two (2) half-gallon plastic jugs due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the pails from falling and cracking. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 10-gallon poly drum and one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
